title: Aftercare Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make A Difference
Interview Descriptions: it Went great. it was Taken by one of the associates. I Was given a task and situation and was asked to give insights. It went very smooth and was hired.
Interview Questions: Will you be available for next 1 year

title: Human Capital Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make A Difference
Interview Descriptions: The directors do a straightforward interview of your goals, learnings and weaknesses in working with make a difference and your role expectations. They would’ve already screened you based on your past performance as a Fellow/City manager. It’s a quick internal process.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations from the role? Biggest learnings from your Fellowship role?

title: Operations Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make A Difference
Interview Descriptions:
Screening round by HR
Technical round by vertical 
 -CEO round - 
Immersion round in office around all employees

Final decision was made post this. Only if you get through all stages you get an offer.
Interview Questions:
Why?
What skills?
Previous experience

title: Fundraising Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make A Difference
Interview Descriptions: Long and lengthy but really fun process. Had multiple rounds and was conducted over a period of 2 months. Included technical interview and HR interview both. Also had lots of assessment tasks
Interview Questions: Previous experiences, Time availability and expectation setting

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make A Difference (Bengaluru)
Interview Descriptions: Amazing, friendly, accommodating, open to know about the candidate. It was a easy 2 - 3 levels in the interview. Group work and challenges. Morning session F2F. Afternoon session F2F + Group discussion & activities.
Interview Questions: Views & what difference can you make

title: Volunteer Interview

title: Teacher Interview

Interview Descriptions: First there was an introduction round. then there were group activity lastly there was a class room teaching interview ,they create a class room situation and test how you teach and mimic real time issues
Interview Questions: Class room interview: they create a class room situation and test how you teach and mimic real time issues

title: City Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make A Difference (Hyderābād)
Interview Descriptions: Started with an elimination round,where in the written tasks were evaluated, followed by a technical role play (telephonic). Shortlisted Candidates had a personal interview (over phone or in person) followed by background check
Interview Questions:
What do you consider your biggest strengths?
How do you handle pressure and how do you plan to manage your time?
How do you respond to a situation like.... and how can you resolve the conflict .... ?

title: Executive Director Support Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Make A Difference (Cochin) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 senior volunteers ask you the reason for choosing make a difference and why should they select you. your asked to demonstrate a mock teaching. various activities are also conducted to measure your activeness and involvements.
Interview Questions: demonstrate how you are planning to teach the children

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make A Difference (Bengaluru) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The candidate is asked to pick a subject of his/her choice and has to present it in front of the panelists for 10 minutes where the panelists pretend to be kids who are not interested in learning.
Interview Questions:
What would you do if the children of your class are not interested?
If your co-teacher is liked more by the children and the children ask you to let that teacher teach instead of you, what would you do?
Interesting ways of teaching a class.

title: Executive Director Support Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make A Difference (Mangalore) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: first they asked us to fill  a formal application . then corresponding to our preferences and vacancy of volunteers we were given a problem statement of varying levels . we were given 2 hours to prepare for it .  A fellow would interview us and would as k questions which usually rises in childrens mind
Interview Questions: what is an angle ?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make A Difference (New Delhi) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Asked two teach to other teachers an easy english grammar concept while they try to create conditions similar to a classroom such as kids disrupting the classroom, or showing unwillingness to study and concentrate or disturbing the diligent kids
Interview Questions: What will you do if the kid does not want to study?
